biospec_descr.textblock: Bone biopsy Serum samples A. epigastrica inferior

brief_summary.textblock:
Disturbances of mineral and bone diseaeses are frequently observed in CKD patients. Renal
      osteodystrophy is the term to describe the bone abnormalities. Epidemiological data showed
      adynamic bone disease (ABD) is the most frequent bone disorder in CKD stage 5D diseases. Low
      PTH, diabetes mellitus, malnutrition, metabolic acidosis, hypogonadism and low 1,25(OH)2D
      vitamin D deficiency are known risk factors for ABD. Mounting experimental data point
      towards a role of protein-bound uremic retention molecules (p-cresyl sulfate and indoxyl
      sulfate) in the pathogenesis and progression of ABD. ABD is not only recognized as a risk
      factor for fractures but also for arterial calcification.

      The aim of the present study is  (1) to investigate the role of indoxyl sulfate and p-cresyl
      sulfate in the pathogenesis and progression of ABD and arterial calcification in CKD stage5
      and (2) to investigate the influence of renal transplantation on bone and arterial
      metabolism.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evolution of Bone Histomorphometry and Vascular Calcification Before and After Renal Transplantation
clinical_study.condition: Chronic Kidney Disease Mineral and Bone Disorder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  eligible for renal transplantation and >18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  use of biphosphonates within the 6 months before the study entry

study_pop.textblock: end stage renal disease patients able to consent

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Study to Investigate the Natural History of Bone Histomorphometry and Vascular Calcification in Dialysis-dependent Patients Before and After Renal Transplantation.

primary_outcome.description: to investigate the role of indoxyl sulfate and p-cresyl sulfate in the pathogenesis and progression of ABD and arterial calcification in CKD stage5
primary_outcome.measure: bone turnover, as assessed by bone biopsy
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the start of the study

primary_outcome.description: to evoluation the evolution of bone turnover after succesfull renal transplantation
primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of bone turnover, as assessed by bone biopsy

primary_outcome.description: the assess the evolution of (the degree of) aortic calcification one year after succesfull renal transplantation
primary_outcome.measure: aortic calcification, as assessed by lumbar X-ray

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
